sorular.soru: Which lights can you use if you only have 40 metres of visibility during the day due to heavy rainfall?

feedback.metin: If you have reduced visibility due to rainfall, you can use your fog lights at the front. The symbol for fog lights at the front can be recognised by the light beam to the left, there is a wavy line (fog) through the beam and the beam is directed downwards. Rear fog lights (left symbol) is never allowed in rainfall, but only in snowfall or fog. Using full-beam headlights during the day is prohibited (middle symbol).

sorular.soru: With which symbol do you switch on your hazard lights?

feedback.metin: The left symbol is for the hazard lights. The middle symbol is for the indicator. The right symbol is for the sidelights.
